senses.de: A stick that produces flame when you rub it on a rough surface
senses.ex: He struck a match to light the candle.

Tips.title: Physical Object
Tips.description: Refers specifically to an object used for ignition.
Tips.example: Pack extra matches for our camping trip.

Tips.title: Not a Lighter
Tips.description: Different from a lighter, a match is a single-use tool.
Tips.example: After the match burned out, he lit another.

senses.de: A competition where people play against each other
senses.ex: I'm going to watch the football match tonight.

Tips.title: Sporting Events
Tips.description: Commonly used to talk about sports competitions.
Tips.example: She scored the winning goal in the match.

Tips.title: Competitive Context
Tips.description: Implies a challenge or contest between individuals or teams.
Tips.example: The chess match lasted for hours.

senses.de: A person who is good to marry or start a romantic relationship with
senses.ex: He seems like a good match for her.

Tips.title: Relationship Potential
Tips.description: Indicates suitability or compatibility in romantic contexts.
Tips.example: They met through a dating app and are a great match.

Tips.title: Evaluate Compatibility
Tips.description: Used when considering how well two people suit each other.
Tips.example: My friend set me up on a date, saying we're a good match.

senses.de: When two things are the same or similar
senses.ex: Your shirt doesn't match your pants.

Tips.title: Similarity
Tips.description: Describes when two or more items look alike or complement each other.
Tips.example: Find socks that match in color and pattern.

Tips.title: Harmony
Tips.description: Highlights the importance of consistency in design or arrangement.
Tips.example: The curtains and sofa match beautifully.

senses.de: To place people or things together because they are similar or compatible
senses.ex: They matched the right candidate to the job opening.

Tips.title: Right Pairing
Tips.description: Concerned with finding a correct or suitable counterpart.
Tips.example: The mentor program matches students with experienced professionals.

Tips.title: Tailored Connections
Tips.description: Connects the concept of customization to personal or professional pairing.
Tips.example: We matched the donation to the charity’s needs.

senses.ex: He will match against the world champion in the final.

Tips.title: Confrontation
Tips.description: Used when someone is faced with an opponent or rival.
Tips.example: Tomorrow, I'll match wits with the debate team leader.

Tips.title: Measure Up
Tips.description: Implies comparing to assess if one is at the same level as another.
Tips.example: Can any other team match their skill level?

Adapt.wordDefinition:
Adapt means to adjust or modify something to fit a particular situation or circumstance. For example, a person may need to adapt to a new school or job by changing their daily routine or behavior.

Adapt is more commonly used when it comes to making changes to oneself or something else to fit a new situation, while match is used when describing two things that are similar or identical.

Combine.wordDefinition:
Combine means to bring two or more things together to make a single entity. For example, combining flour, eggs, and sugar to make a cake.

Combine is often used when talking about mixing or blending ingredients in cooking or chemistry.

Complement.wordDefinition:
Complement means something that enhances or completes another thing. For example, if you are wearing a blue shirt, a pair of brown shoes would complement the shirt.

Complement means something that goes well with another thing, while match means the two things are similar or the same.

Congruent.wordDefinition:
Congruent describes two objects that have the same shape and size, while the word match describes two objects that are similar or complementary in some way.

For example, two triangles are congruent if they have the same angle measurements and side lengths. On the other hand, two socks can match if they have the same color or pattern.

Congruent describes objects that are identical in shape and size, while match describes objects that go well together or are similar in some way.

Correspond.wordDefinition:
The words correspond and match are similar but there are slight differences.

Correspond means to have a similarity or connection with something else. For example, if two things have similar features or characteristics, they can be said to correspond with each other.

Correspond describes similarities or connections between two things, while match is used to find something that fits a certain requirement.

Equal.wordDefinition:
Equal means two or more things are the same in value, size, quantity or quality. For example, 4 + 4 is equal to 8, because both sides have the same value.

Equal is used to compare the value of two or more things, while match describes the similarity of two or more things.

Harmonize.wordDefinition:
To harmonize means to make things blend well together, like different notes in a song. This can be applied in music, but also in decorating a room or creating a menu with complementary flavors.

In essence, harmonize is about finding components that go well together, while match is about finding components that are the same or similar.

Homogeneous.wordDefinition:
Homogeneous means that something is made up of the same kind of things or parts. For example, milk is homogeneous because it is made up of the same kind of molecules throughout.

Homogeneous describes the composition of something, while match describes the similarity or compatibility of two things.

Pair.wordDefinition:
Match means two things that are the same or similar to each other. For example, a pair of shoes that are the same color and size can be called a match.

Pair means two things that are meant to go together, but not necessarily the same. For example, a pair of socks can be different colors or patterns, but they are still meant to be worn together.

Match describes things that are the same, while pair describes things that go together even if they are not the same.

quotes.Text: We need the right attitude and the right motivation - that can decide the match above everything else.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Sergio Ramos

quotes.Text: I always want to play. It is important to gain match rhythm.
quotes.Title: Dutch Athlete
quotes.Name: Arjen Robben

quotes.Text: Matching character and actor is what a good director does.
quotes.Title: French Director
quotes.Name: Bruno Dumont

quotes.Text: It's important for me to play every match the best I can.
quotes.Title: Dutch Athlete
quotes.Name: Memphis Depay

quotes.Text: The most important competition is always the next match.
quotes.Title: Armenian Athlete
quotes.Name: Henrikh Mkhitaryan

quotes.Text: I take every match as a final. It's very important.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Garbine Muguruza

quotes.Text: The matches with the national team give me life.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Isco

quotes.Text: Each match I play is the most important one yet.
quotes.Title: Indian Celebrity
quotes.Name: Viswanathan Anand

quotes.Text: It's important to get match rhythm.
quotes.Title: Spanish Athlete
quotes.Name: Raul

quotes.Text: To me, every match is important.
quotes.Title: Uruguayan Athlete
quotes.Name: Edinson Cavani
